title: Biotech Startups Seeking to Boost New Drug Targets Win Venture Funding
sub_head: Venture-capital firms are backing companies working to tackle the problem of ‘undruggable’ proteins
body:
Venture capitalists are financing startups seeking to increase the number of molecular targets for drugmakers to pursue, potentially enabling new treatments for cancer and other diseases.
Many drugs work by inhibiting proteins involved in a disease. But the number of proteins accessible to drugmakers is limited because most disease-associated proteins are considered “undruggable,” meaning scientists have been unable to develop compounds against them, investors and entrepreneurs said.
Startups...
